import plotly.plotly as py
import plotly.graph_objs as go

import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("testD.csv")

trace_high = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Unsafe water source (deaths)'],
                name = "Access to water",
                line = dict(color = '#17BECF'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_low = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['No access to handwashing facility (deaths)'],
                name = "Access to handwashing",
                line = dict(color = '#7F7F7F'),
                opacity = 0.8)


trace_3 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Low physical activity (deaths)'],
                name = "Low physical activity",
                line = dict(color = '#17cfb2'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_4 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Poor sanitation (deaths)'],
                name = "Poor sansation",
                line = dict(color = '#acafc6'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_5 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Diet low in fruits (deaths)'],
                name = "Diet low friut",
                line = dict(color = '#094c52'),
                opacity = 0.8)
trace_52 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Diet low in vegetables (deaths)'],
                name = "Diet low vegetables",
                line = dict(color = '#269a51'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_6 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Household air pollution (deaths)'],
                name = "Air pollution",
                line = dict(color = '#becf17'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_7 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Drug use (deaths)'],
                name = "Drug use",
                line = dict(color = '#7117cf'),
                opacity = 0.8)


trace_8 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Alcohol use (deaths)'],
                name = "Alcohol use",
                line = dict(color = '#e2d0f5'),
                opacity = 0.8)


trace_9 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Smoking (deaths)'],
                name = "Smoking",
                line = dict(color = '#d8bc15'),
                opacity = 0.8)



data = [trace_high,trace_low,trace_3,trace_4,trace_5,trace_52,trace_6,trace_7,trace_8,trace_9]

layout = dict(
    title = "Deaths in Africa",
    xaxis = dict(
        range = ['1990-01-01','2017-01-01'])
)

fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
py.iplot(fig, filename = "Deaths in africa")

import plotly.plotly as py
import plotly.graph_objs as go

import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("totalRisk.csv")

trace_high = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Unsafe water source (deaths)'],
                name = "Access to clean water",
                line = dict(color = '#17BECF'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_low = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['No access to handwashing facility (deaths)'],
                name = "Access to handwashing facilities",
                line = dict(color = '#7F7F7F'),
                opacity = 0.8)


trace_3 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Low physical activity (deaths)'],
                name = "Low physical activity",
                line = dict(color = '#17cfb2'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_4 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Poor sanitation (deaths)'],
                name = "Poor sansation",
                line = dict(color = '#acafc6'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_5 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Diet low in fruits (deaths)'],
                name = "Diet low friut",
                line = dict(color = '#094c52'),
                opacity = 0.8)
trace_52 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Diet low in vegetables (deaths)'],
                name = "Diet low vegetables",
                line = dict(color = '#269a51'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_6 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Household air pollution (deaths)'],
                name = "Air pollution",
                line = dict(color = '#becf17'),
                opacity = 0.8)

trace_7 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Drug use (deaths)'],
                name = "Drug use",
                line = dict(color = '#7117cf'),
                opacity = 0.8)


trace_8 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Alcohol use (deaths)'],
                name = "Alcohol use",
                line = dict(color = '#e2d0f5'),
                opacity = 0.8)


trace_9 = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Smoking (deaths)'],
                name = "Smoking",
                line = dict(color = '#d8bc15'),
                opacity = 0.8)



data = [trace_high,trace_low,trace_3,trace_4,trace_5,trace_52,trace_6,trace_7,trace_8,trace_9]

layout = dict(
    title = "Number of deaths by risk factor aged 15-49 in Africa (1990-2016)",
    xaxis = dict(
        range = ['1990-01-01','2017-01-01'])
)

fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
py.iplot(fig, filename = "Deaths in africa")

import plotly.plotly as py
import plotly.graph_objs as go

import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("totalRisk.csv")

water = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Unsafe water source (deaths)'],
                name = "Access to clean water",
                line = dict(color = '#17BECF'),
                opacity = 0.8)

washing = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['No access to handwashing facility (deaths)'],
                name = "Access to handwashing facilities",
                line = dict(color = '#7F7F7F'),
                opacity = 0.8)


activity = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Low physical activity (deaths)'],
                name = "Low physical activity",
                line = dict(color = '#17cfb2'),
                opacity = 0.8)   

""" poorsensation = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Poor sanitation (deaths)'],
                name = "Poor sansation",
                line = dict(color = '#acafc6'),
                opacity = 0.8)  """

"""  fruit = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Diet low in fruits (deaths)'],
                name = "Diet low friut",
                line = dict(color = '#094c52'),
                opacity = 0.8)   """
"""veg = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Diet low in vegetables (deaths)'],
                name = "Diet low vegetables",
                line = dict(color = '#269a51'),
                opacity = 0.8) """ 

pollution = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Household air pollution (deaths)'],
                name = "Air pollution",
                line = dict(color = '#becf17'),
                opacity = 0.8)

druguse = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Drug use (deaths)'],
                name = "Drug use",
                line = dict(color = '#7117cf'),
                opacity = 0.8)


alcohol = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Alcohol use (deaths)'],
                name = "Alcohol use",
                line = dict(color = '#e2d0f5'),
                opacity = 0.8)


smoking = go.Scatter(
                x=df.Year,
                y=df['Smoking (deaths)'],
                name = "Smoking",
                line = dict(color = '#d8bc15'),
                opacity = 0.8)



data = [water,washing,activity,pollution,druguse,alcohol , smoking]

layout = dict(
    title = "Number of deaths by risk factor aged 15-49 in Africa (1990-2016)",
    xaxis = dict(
        range = ['1990-01-01','2017-01-01'])
)

fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
py.iplot(fig, filename = "Deaths in africa")
